paragraphs.text: Paris terror attack: Journalism is under fire.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Courageous journalism is under attack today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The horrifying shooting by masked gunmen at a Paris magazine office, which has left 12 dead, is an assault on everyone in the news business
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the fact that the paper, Charlie Hebdo, is a satirical publication matters not at all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: since
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: satire can sting as sharply as any media commentary -- especially when it comes to the sensitive subject of religion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Several news outlets are reporting that the attackers identified themselves as being from Al Qaeda in Yemen
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whatever branch of Islamic terrorism is responsible for this heinous crime, the targeting of the French paper is no accident
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On its cover today is a caricature of a controversial novelist, Michel Houellebecq
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: whose book"Submission" forecasts a France run by Muslims and where polygamy is practiced
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And the last tweet posted by the magazine was a mocking spoof of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Charlie Hebdo has been a target before
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Its offices were firebombed in 2011
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: after the paper ran a cartoon of the Prophet Muhammad vowing "100 lashes if you don't die laughing!"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The vicious attack would be shocking news
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the target was an insurance company office
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But by
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: singling out a media enterprise -- especially one that has dared to poke fun at Islam-- the terrorists are sending an even louder message
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: one designed to frighten and intimidate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We saw the same evil calculation in the decision by ISIS to kill journalists James Foley and Steve Sotloff and to circulate video of their beheadings
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This was a way to amplify the propaganda value of such executions and generate even more coverage by journalists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who felt an instinctive kinship with their fallen brethren
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That ploy worked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: ISIS sparked weeks of anguished coverage around the globe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the images of the soon-to-be-murdered journalists, published far too often in my view, became the face of Islamic terror
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After that, even as the U.S  and its allies struck back at ISIS in Iraq and Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the coverage greatly receded
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Terrorists understand the media's need to personalize a tragic story
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Wednesday's attack was also a far bloodier version of the Sony Pictures hacking
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which was aimed at paralyzing and humiliating a media company over its ill-advised film that depicted North Korean strongman Kim Jong-un's head being blown up
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That act of cyberterrorism also served as a warning to other media outfits that might take on North Korea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Charlie Hebdo specialized in skewering sacred cows
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Its pages are filled with vulgar caricatures and caustic humor, lampooning politicians, entertainers and media personalities of all stripes," the New York Times reported three years ago,"and the magazine has found itself a frequent presence at Paris courts, accused on several dozen occasions of defamation or inciting hate
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "The world's religions have also been favorite targets of the paper, this being France, where state-mandated secularism is a sort of religion of its own. The cover page of one recent issue featured a cartoon of three rolls of toilet paper, labeled Bible, Koran and Torah, and the headline: 'In the toilet, all the religions
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The danger now is that journalists around the world will engage in self- censorship, that they will pull back on aggressive reporting and analysis of Islamic terrorism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For every potentially provocative article, headline or cartoon, some will ask themselves, is this worth the risk?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Wouldn't it be easier, safer, to let this one go?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And each time that happens, the gunmen who unleashed a hail of bullets in a Paris magazine office Wednesday will have won
paragraphs.label: assumption
